clinical_note.text: SUBJECTIVE: 58-year-old female presents with progressive fatigue over the last 3 months. Reports unintentional weight loss of 12 lbs during this period. No changes in diet. Denies gross hematochezia or melena, but admits to occasional abdominal bloating. PMH significant for HTN, T2DM. Family history is notable for father diagnosed with colon cancer at age 62. OBJECTIVE: BP 138/86, HR 78, Temp 98.6, BMI 28.4. Physical exam: Patient appears pale. Conjunctival pallor noted. Abdomen is soft, non-tender, no palpable masses or organomegaly. ASSESSMENT: 1. Unintentional weight loss and fatigue. 2. Microcytic anemia suspected. 3. Family history of GI malignancy. Need to r/o colon cancer. PLAN: Order CBC, CMP, and Chest X-ray. Referral placed for screening/diagnostic colonoscopy.

orders.failure_reason: Patient has not scheduled appointment despite referral outbound

results.full_text: Hgb: 9.8 g/dL (Low), Hct: 30%, MCV: 72 fL (Low), RDW: 16.5% (High). Findings consistent with iron deficiency anemia.
Lungs are clear. No pleural effusions. Heart size normal. Note is made of mild mediastinal lymphadenopathy measuring up to 1.2cm in the paratracheal station. Recommend clinical correlation.

differential: Iron deficiency anemia secondary to GI blood loss
diagnostic_hypothesis.reasoning: Symptoms of weight loss and fatigue combined with microcytic anemia and a strong family history of colorectal cancer highly suggest a GI malignancy.

failure_mode: Colonoscopy never completed, X-ray lymphadenopathy overlooked
ai_should_flag: Unscheduled high-priority colonoscopy referral in the context of anemia
Overlooked incidental finding of 1.2cm mediastinal lymphadenopathy
Failure to close the loop on 'r/o colon cancer' assessment
